description.en: Sweet rice and coconut balls made from leftover cooked rice, jaggery, and sesame seeds for a nostalgic Sri Lankan treat.
description.si: ඉතිරි වූ පිසූ බත්, හකුරු සහ තල ඇට වලින් සාදන ලද පැණිරස බත් සහ පොල් බෝල, ශ්‍රී ලාංකික සංග්‍රහයක් සඳහා.

steps.en: Reheat leftovers to 74 °C/165 °F; do not keep cooked rice at room temperature >2 hrs; refrigerate ≤4 °C/40 °F.
steps.si: ඉතිරි වූ බත් 74 °C/165 °F දක්වා නැවත උණුසුම් කරන්න; පිසූ බත් කාමර උෂ්ණත්වයේදී පැය 2කට වඩා වැඩි කාලයක් තබා නොගන්න; ශීතකරණය කරන්න ≤4 °C/40 °F.

steps.en: Warm coconut oil in a pan over low heat for 1 min; toast sesame seed until fragrant, 2–3 min, and set aside.
steps.si: පොල්තෙල් පෑන් එකක දමා අඩු ගින්දරේ විනාඩි 1ක් රත් කරන්න; තල ඇට සුවඳ එනතුරු විනාඩි 2-3ක් බැදගෙන පසෙකින් තබන්න.

steps.en: Melt palm jaggery with coconut treacle and water over low heat, stirring until a thick syrup forms, 4–5 min.
steps.si: පොල් පැණි සහ ජලය සමග තල් හකුරු උණු කර, ඝන සිරප් එකක් සෑදෙන තුරු විනාඩි 4-5ක් අඩු ගින්දරේ කලවම් කරන්න.

steps.en: Mash cooked rice in a bowl until slightly sticky; fold in grated coconut, cardamom powder, and a pinch of salt.
steps.si: පිසූ බත් බඳුනක තරමක් ඇලෙන තුරු පොඩි කරන්න; ගාන ලද පොල්, එනසාල් කුඩු සහ ලුණු ස්වල්පයක් එකතු කරන්න.

steps.en: Pour warm jaggery syrup into the rice mixture; mix thoroughly, then knead in rice flour until it holds together.
steps.si: සහල් මිශ්‍රණයට උණුසුම් හකුරු සිරප් වත් කරන්න; හොඳින් මිශ්‍ර කරන්න, පසුව සහල් පිටි එකට තද වන තුරු අනා ගන්න.

steps.en: Grease palms; shape 16 equal balls, 3–4 cm each, pressing firmly to bind.
steps.si: අත්ලෙහි තෙල් ආලේප කරන්න; එකිනෙක සෙ.මී. 3-4 ක් පමණ වන සමාන බෝල 16 ක් හැඩගස්වා, බැඳීමට තදින් තද කරන්න.

steps.en: Roll each ball in toasted sesame seed to coat evenly.
steps.si: සෑම බෝලයක්ම ඒකාකාරව ආලේප කිරීම සඳහා බැදපු තල ඇටවල රෝල් කරන්න.

steps.en: Chill aggala 20 min to firm up.
steps.si: තදින් තද වීමට අග්ගලා විනාඩි 20ක් සිසිල් කරන්න.

description.en: A wok-tossed stir-fry of leftover string hoppers with vegetables, egg, and aromatics for a quick street-style meal.
description.si: ඉතිරි ඉඳිආප්ප, එළවළු, බිත්තර සහ සුවඳ ද්‍රව්‍ය සමඟ වොක්-ටෝස් කර බැදපු, වීදි විලාසිතාවේ ඉක්මන් ආහාර වේලක් සඳහා.

steps.en: Break string hoppers into strands; set aside.
steps.si: ඉඳි ආප්ප කෙලින් කෑලි වලට බිඳ; පසෙකින් තබන්න.

steps.en: Heat coconut oil in a wok on medium-high 2 min; add onion, garlic, green chili, and curry leaf; stir-fry 2–3 min.
steps.si: පොල්තෙල් වෝක් එකක මධ්‍යම ප්‍රමාණයේ තාපය මත විනාඩි 2ක් රත් කරන්න; ළූණු, සුදුළූණු, අමු මිරිස් සහ කරපිංචා එකතු කරන්න; කලවම් කර විනාඩි 2-3ක් බැදගන්න.

steps.en: Add carrot, leek, and cabbage; cook 3–4 min until crisp-tender.
steps.si: කැරට්, ලීක්ස් සහ ගෝවා එකතු කරන්න; හැපෙනසුළු මෘදු වන තෙක් මිනිත්තු 3-4 ක් උයන්න.

steps.en: Push vegetables aside; scramble egg 1–2 min until just set.
steps.si: එළවළු පසෙකට දමන්න; බිත්තරය හොඳින් සෙට් වන තුරු මිනිත්තු 1-2ක් ස්ක්‍රැම්බල් කරන්න.

steps.en: Sprinkle roasted curry powder and chili flakes; toss 30 sec.
steps.si: බැදපු තුනපහ සහ කෑලි මිරිස් දමා; 30 තත්පරයක් හොඳින් මිශ්‍ර කරන්න.

steps.en: Add string hoppers; drizzle soy sauce and coconut milk; toss vigorously 3–4 min until hot and coated.
steps.si: ඉඳි ආප්ප එකතු කරන්න; සෝයා සෝස් සහ පොල් කිරි වත් කරන්න; රත් වී ආලේප කරන තෙක් මිනිත්තු 3-4ක් තදින් කලවම් කරන්න.

steps.en: Season with salt; serve immediately.
steps.si: ලුණු දමා රස කර වහාම පිළිගන්වන්න.

description.en: A quick kottu using chopped day-old bread stir-fried with eggs, vegetables, and spices for a hearty snack or dinner.
description.si: හෘදයාංගම කෙටි ආහාරයක් හෝ රාත්‍රී ආහාරයක් සඳහා බිත්තර, එළවළු සහ කුළුබඩු සමඟ බැදපු දිනක් පැරණි පාන් භාවිතා කර සාදන ලද ඉක්මන් කොත්තුවක්.

steps.en: Cube bread into 2 cm pieces; set aside.
steps.si: පාන් සෙන්ටිමීටර 2 ක කැබලිවලට කපා පසෙකින් තබන්න.

steps.en: Heat coconut oil in a wok on medium-high; add onion, green chili, and curry leaf; sauté 2–3 min.
steps.si: පොල්තෙල් වෝක් එකක මධ්‍යම ප්‍රමාණයේ රත් කරන්න; ළූණු, අමු මිරිස් සහ කරපිංචා එකතු කරන්න; විනාඩි 2-3ක් බැදගන්න.

steps.en: Add capsicum and tomato; cook 2 min until softened.
steps.si: කැප්සිකම් සහ තක්කාලි එකතු කරන්න; මෘදු වන තුරු මිනිත්තු 2 ක් උයන්න.

steps.en: Push to the side; scramble egg 1–2 min until just set.
steps.si: පැත්තට තල්ලු කරන්න; බිත්තරය හරියටම සෙට් වන තුරු මිනිත්තු 1-2ක් ස්ක්‍රැම්බල් කරන්න.

steps.en: Add bread; sprinkle roasted curry powder and chili powder; toss 3–4 min until bread is hot and lightly crisp.
steps.si: පාන් එකතු කරන්න; බැදපු කරපිංචා කුඩු සහ මිරිස් කුඩු ඉසිය යුතු ය; පාන් උණුසුම් හා සැහැල්ලුවෙන් හැපෙන තුරු මිනිත්තු 3-4 ක් බැදගන්න.

steps.en: Drizzle soy sauce; stir-fry 1 min; season with salt.
steps.si: සෝයා සෝස් ස්වල්පයක් වත් කරන්න; විනාඩි 1ක් බැදගන්න; ලුණු එකතු කරන්න.

steps.en: Serve hot.
steps.si: උණුසුම් සේවය කරන්න.

description.en: A custardy baked pudding scented with cardamom and nutmeg, perfect for using up stale bread.
description.si: එනසාල් සහ සාදික්කා සුවඳින් යුත් කස්ටඩ් බේක් කළ පුඩිං, පරණ පාන් භාවිතා කිරීමට හොඳයි.

steps.en: Preheat oven to 180 °C; grease a 20 cm baking dish with butter.
steps.si: උඳුන 180°C දක්වා රත් කරන්න; සෙන්ටිමීටර 20ක් උස ෙබ්කිං පිඟානක් බටර් සමග ආලේප කරන්න.

steps.en: Tear bread into bite-size pieces; spread in the baking dish.
steps.si: පාන් කුඩා කැබලිවලට ඉරා, ෙබ්කිං පිඟානේ තබන්න.

steps.en: Warm milk, sugar, cardamom powder, nutmeg powder, and salt over low heat until sugar dissolves; cool 5 min.
steps.si: කිරි, සීනි, එනසාල් කුඩු, සාදික්කා කුඩු සහ ලුණු දමා සීනි දියවන තුරු අඩු ගින්දරේ රත් කරන්න; විනාඩි 5ක් සිසිල් කරන්න.

steps.en: Whisk eggs with vanilla extract; slowly whisk in warm milk mixture.
steps.si: වැනිලා සාරය සමඟ බිත්තර ගසන්න; උණුසුම් කිරි මිශ්‍රණය සෙමින් ගසන්න.

steps.en: Tear bread into pieces; mix with raisins; pour custard over; rest 10 min to soak.
steps.si: පාන් කැබලිවලට ඉරා දමන්න; මුද්දරප්පලම් සමඟ මිශ්‍ර කරන්න; කස්ටඩ් වත් කරන්න; පොඟවා ගැනීමට විනාඩි 10 ක් තබන්න.

steps.en: Dot top with butter; bake 30–35 min until set and golden at the edges.
steps.si: උඩින් බටර් තවරන්න; සෙට් වන තුරු සහ දාර රන්වන් පැහැ වන තුරු මිනිත්තු 30-35ක් බේක් කරන්න.

steps.en: Cool 10 min before slicing and serving.
steps.si: කපා පිළිගැන්වීමට පෙර මිනිත්තු 10 ක් ශීතල කරන්න.

title: String Hopper Aasmi
description: Crisp, lacy coils made from leftover string hoppers, finished with sweet treacle drizzle.

steps: Reheat leftovers to 74 °C/165 °F; do not keep batters at room temperature >2 hrs; refrigerate ≤4 °C/40 °F.
Whisk string hopper batter with coconut milk and salt to ribbon consistency.
Heat coconut oil in a deep pan to 170–175 °C.
Pipe batter in concentric coils; fry 2–3 min per side until pale golden and crisp; drain well.
Simmer sugar, coconut treacle, and cardamom powder 3–4 min to a thin syrup.
Drizzle syrup over cooled aasmi just before serving for best texture.

title: Fried Rice (Sri Lankan Style)
description: Wok-fried day-old rice tossed with vegetables, egg, and Sri Lankan aromatics for a fast meal.

steps: Reheat leftovers to 74 °C/165 °F; do not keep cooked rice at room temperature >2 hrs; refrigerate ≤4 °C/40 °F.
Break up cold cooked rice with fingers to remove clumps.
Heat coconut oil in a wok over high heat; add onion, garlic, ginger, and curry leaf; stir-fry 1–2 min.
Add carrot, leek, and green pea; cook 2–3 min until crisp-tender.
Push vegetables aside; scramble egg 1 min until just set.
Add rice; toss vigorously 3–4 min until steaming hot.
Season with soy sauce, white pepper powder, and salt; stir 1 min and serve.

title: Fish Cutlets
description: Crisp, spiced fish cutlets bound with potato and chilies, perfect for tea-time or parties.

steps: Reheat leftovers to 74 °C/165 °F; do not keep cooked fish at room temperature >2 hrs; refrigerate ≤4 °C/40 °F.
Boil potato until tender, 12–15 min; mash and cool.
Flake cooked fish; sauté onion, green chili, and curry leaf 3–4 min; mix with fish.
Combine fish mixture with mashed potato, chili powder, black pepper powder, lime juice, and salt.
Form 16 balls; flatten to 2 cm patties.
Dip in beaten egg; coat with breadcrumbs.
Deep-fry at 170–175 °C until golden, 2–3 min per side; drain well before serving.

title: Rice Pudding
description: Creamy cardamom rice pudding simmered in coconut milk to transform day-old rice into dessert.

steps: Reheat leftovers to 74 °C/165 °F; do not keep cooked rice at room temperature >2 hrs; refrigerate ≤4 °C/40 °F.
Combine coconut milk and milk in a saucepan; bring to a gentle simmer over medium heat.
Stir in cooked rice; simmer 10–12 min, stirring to prevent sticking.
Add sugar, cardamom powder, cinnamon powder, and a pinch of salt; cook 5–7 min until creamy.
Fold in raisins and cashew; rest 5 min before serving warm.

title: Sri Lankan Spiced Banana Bread
description: Moist banana bread infused with cardamom and cloves, ideal for using overripe bananas.

steps: Reheat leftovers to 74 °C/165 °F; handle ripe fruit safely and avoid room temperature storage >2 hrs.
Preheat oven to 175 °C; line a 23×13 cm loaf tin.
Cream butter and sugar 2–3 min; beat in eggs and vanilla extract.
Mash banana; fold into wet mixture.
Whisk wheat flour, baking soda, cardamom powder, cinnamon powder, clove powder, and salt; fold into batter just until combined.
Transfer to tin; bake 45–50 min until a skewer comes out clean.
Cool 10–15 min before slicing.

title: Spicy Sweet Potato Hummus
description: A creamy hummus with roasted sweet potato, chili, and lime for a Lankan twist on a dip.

steps: Reheat leftovers to 74 °C/165 °F when using pre-cooked ingredients; refrigerate dips ≤4 °C/40 °F.
Roast sweet potato at 200 °C for 20–25 min until soft; cool slightly.
Blend chickpea, roasted sweet potato, lime juice, coconut oil, garlic, chili powder, cumin powder, black pepper powder, and salt.
Add water gradually for desired consistency; process 1–2 min until smooth.
Chill 30 min and serve with vegetables or roti.

title: Fridge-Raid Vegetable Soup
description: A warming soup using assorted leftover vegetables with Lankan spices and coconut milk.

steps: Reheat leftovers to 74 °C/165 °F; keep cooked vegetables refrigerated ≤4 °C/40 °F until use.
Heat coconut oil in a pot on medium; sauté onion, garlic, ginger, and curry leaf 3–4 min.
Add mixed vegetable; cook 3 min with cumin powder and turmeric powder.
Pour in vegetable stock; simmer 12–15 min until tender.
Blend partially for texture; stir in coconut milk and salt; warm 2–3 min and serve.

title: Creamy Curried Chicken & Rice Soup
description: Comforting soup using leftover chicken and rice simmered in a lightly spiced coconut broth.

steps: Reheat leftovers to 74 °C/165 °F; do not keep cooked rice or chicken at room temperature >2 hrs; refrigerate ≤4 °C/40 °F.
Heat coconut oil in a pot over medium; sauté onion, garlic, ginger, and curry leaf 3–4 min.
Add carrot and leek; cook 3 min; sprinkle mild curry powder and stir 30 sec.
Pour in chicken stock; simmer 8–10 min until vegetables are tender.
Add cooked chicken and cooked rice; simmer 3–4 min until hot.
Stir in coconut milk and salt; warm gently 2 min and serve.

title: Parippu (Red Lentil Dhal Curry)
description: Creamy masoor dhal tempered with mustard, curry leaves, and coconut milk, a staple side.

steps: Rinse red lentil until water runs clear; drain.
Simmer lentils with 500 ml water, turmeric powder, and salt on medium 12–15 min until soft.
Heat coconut oil in a pan; splutter mustard seed; add onion, garlic, green chili, and curry leaf; sauté 3–4 min.
Combine tempering with dhal; pour in coconut milk; simmer 3–4 min until creamy.
Adjust seasoning and serve warm.

title: Pol Sambol (Coconut Sambol)
description: Fresh grated coconut mixed with chili, onion, and lime; the essential island relish.

steps: Pound onion, red chili powder, and salt in a mortar to a coarse paste, 1–2 min.
Add grated coconut and maldive fish; pound and mix 1–2 min to combine.
Fold in lime juice; adjust salt and serve immediately.

title: Seeni Sambol (Caramelized Onion Relish)
description: Slow-cooked onions with chili, tamarind, and spices until sticky-sweet; a breakfast favorite.

steps: Slice onion thinly.
Heat coconut oil on medium; add cinnamon stick and onion; cook 10–12 min until soft.
Add red chili flakes and salt; continue stirring 8–10 min until lightly caramelized.
Stir in jaggery and tamarind juice; cook 5–7 min until jammy.
Fold in maldive fish; cook 1 min; cool and store.

title: Kiri Hodi (Coconut Gravy)
description: A mild, golden coconut gravy tempered with mustard and curry leaves; ideal with hoppers or string hoppers.

steps: Heat coconut oil in a pan on medium; splutter mustard seed 30 sec.
Add onion, green chili, and curry leaf; sauté 1–2 min.
Pour in thin coconut milk; add turmeric powder and salt; simmer 5–6 min.
Stir in thick coconut milk; warm 1–2 min without boiling.
Serve immediately.

title: Plain Hoppers (Appa)
description: Fermented rice-flour bowls with crisp edges and soft centers, cooked in a hopper pan.

steps: Whisk rice flour, sugar, dry yeast, coconut milk, and water to a thin batter; cover and ferment 8–10 hr until bubbly.
Season with salt; rest 15 min.
Grease hopper pan lightly with coconut oil; heat on medium.
Ladle batter; swirl to coat sides; cover and cook 2–3 min until edges are crisp and center set.
Repeat for remaining batter; serve hot with kiri hodi or lunu miris.

title: Egg Hoppers (Biththara Appa)
description: Crisp-edged hoppers finished with a soft-set egg and a sprinkle of pepper.

steps: Prepare hopper batter as for plain hoppers; ferment 8–10 hr until bubbly.
Season with salt; rest 15 min.
Heat and oil hopper pan; swirl batter and crack an egg into the center.
Cover and cook 3–4 min until white is set and yolk soft; sprinkle black pepper powder.
Serve immediately with lunu miris.

title: String Hoppers (Idiyappam)
description: Delicate steamed rice-flour noodles pressed into nests, perfect with kiri hodi and sambols.

steps: Scald water; add salt and coconut oil.
Mix hot water into rice flour to form a soft, non-sticky dough; rest 10 min.
Load dough into idiyappam press; press onto greased mats in spiral nests.
Steam over boiling water 6–7 min until set and springy.
Cool briefly; serve warm.

title: Chicken Kottu Roti
description: Street-style chopped godhamba roti tossed with chicken, egg, vegetables, and spice.

steps: Chop roti into 2 cm strips.
Heat coconut oil on high in a flat griddle; sauté onion and curry leaf 1–2 min.
Add chicken; stir-fry 4–5 min until cooked through.
Add carrot and cabbage; cook 2–3 min.
Move to side; scramble egg 1–2 min.
Add roti; sprinkle roasted curry powder, chili flakes, soy sauce, and salt; chop and toss 3–4 min until hot.
Serve immediately.

title: Vegetable Kottu Roti
description: Chopped roti stir-fried with mixed vegetables, egg, and spice for a satisfying vegetarian kottu.

steps: Chop roti finely.
Heat coconut oil on high; sauté onion, green chili, and curry leaf 2 min.
Add mixed vegetable; stir-fry 3–4 min until crisp.
Scramble egg on the side 1–2 min.
Add roti; season with roasted curry powder, chili flakes, soy sauce, and salt.
Chop and toss 3–4 min until hot; serve.

title: Devilled Chicken
description: A sweet, sour, and spicy stir-fry of chicken with onions and peppers in a glossy sauce.

steps: Marinate chicken with soy sauce, vinegar, black pepper powder, and salt 15 min.
Heat coconut oil in a wok on high; stir-fry chicken 5–6 min until browned.
Add onion and capsicum; cook 3–4 min until crisp-tender.
Stir in tomato sauce and chili flakes; toss 1–2 min to glaze.
Adjust seasoning and serve hot.

title: Devilled Prawns
description: Juicy prawns tossed in a fiery sweet-sour glaze with onions and chilies.

steps: Marinate prawn with soy sauce, vinegar, black pepper powder, and salt for 10 min.
Heat coconut oil on high; stir-fry prawn 2–3 min until just pink.
Add onion and capsicum; cook 2 min.
Stir in tomato sauce and chili flakes; toss 1–2 min to coat.
Serve immediately.

title: Fish Curry (Thuna Paha)
description: A robust fish curry with the classic roasted three-spice blend, coconut, and fragrant leaves.

steps: Marinate fish with lime juice, salt, and 1 teaspoon roasted curry powder for 10 min.
Heat coconut oil; fry fenugreek seed 30 sec; add onion, garlic, ginger, curry leaf, and pandan leaf; sauté 3–4 min.
Add remaining roasted curry powder and chili powder; stir 30 sec.
Add fish and 300 ml water; simmer gently 10–12 min until just cooked.
Stir in coconut milk; simmer 3–4 min; adjust salt and serve.

title: Fish Ambul Thiyal (Sour Fish Curry)
description: Dry-style sour fish curry with goraka and pepper, simmered until the gravy clings.

steps: Soak goraka in warm water 10 min; grind to a paste.
Rub tuna with goraka paste, turmeric powder, black pepper powder, and salt; rest 15 min.
Arrange tuna in a shallow pan with onion, garlic, curry leaf, and 150 ml water.
Simmer covered on low 20–25 min without stirring, tilting pan to baste.
Uncover and cook 5–7 min until gravy thickens and coats fish; rest 10 min before serving.

title: Polos Curry (Young Jackfruit)
description: Tender young jackfruit simmered with roasted spices and coconut for a meaty, vegan curry.

steps: Parboil young jackfruit 10 min; drain.
Heat coconut oil; splutter mustard seed; add onion, garlic, ginger, curry leaf, and pandan leaf; sauté 4–5 min.
Stir in roasted curry powder and chili powder 30 sec.
Add jackfruit and 400 ml water; simmer covered 30–35 min until tender.
Stir in coconut milk and salt; simmer 5–7 min until thickened.
Rest 10 min before serving.

title: Beetroot Curry
description: Julienned beetroot cooked with mustard, coconut, and mild spice for a vibrant side dish.

steps: Heat coconut oil; splutter mustard seed.
Add onion, green chili, and curry leaf; sauté 2–3 min.
Stir in beetroot and turmeric powder; cook 2 min.
Add 200 ml water; simmer 8–10 min until tender-crisp.
Pour in coconut milk; simmer 2–3 min; season with salt and serve.

title: Cashew & Green Pea Curry
description: Rich cashews and peas simmered in a spiced coconut gravy, a festive vegetarian favorite.

steps: Soak cashew in hot water 20 min; drain.
Heat coconut oil; sauté onion and curry leaf 2–3 min.
Add cashew and green pea; stir 2 min.
Sprinkle cumin powder and turmeric powder; add 250 ml water; simmer 10–12 min.
Pour in coconut milk; simmer 3–4 min; season with salt and serve.

title: Brinjal Moju (Eggplant Pickle)
description: Tangy-sweet fried eggplant pickle tempered with mustard, chili, and vinegar; keeps well.

steps: Slice eggplant into 1 cm batons; salt 10 min; pat dry.
Deep-fry in coconut oil at 170–175 °C until golden; drain.
Boil vinegar and sugar 2–3 min to dissolve.
Heat 2 tablespoons coconut oil; splutter mustard seed; add onion, curry leaf, and chili flakes; fry 3–4 min.
Combine fried eggplant with vinegar syrup and tempering; season with salt; cool before bottling.

title: Gotukola Sambol
description: Bright herb salad of finely chopped gotukola with coconut, onion, and lime.

steps: Chop gotukola very finely.
Mix with grated coconut, onion, and green chili.
Season with lime juice and salt; toss and serve immediately.

title: Mukunuwenna Mallung (Leafy Greens Stir-Fry)
description: Quick sauté of chopped amaranth greens with coconut and mild spice.

steps: Heat coconut oil; splutter mustard seed.
Add onion, curry leaf, and turmeric powder; sauté 2 min.
Add amaranth leaf; stir 2–3 min until wilted.
Fold in grated coconut and salt; cook 1–2 min and serve.

title: Pol Roti (Coconut Flatbread)
description: Thick coconut flatbreads cooked on a griddle; great with lunu miris or seeni sambol.

steps: Mix wheat flour, grated coconut, onion, green chili, and salt.
Add water gradually to form a soft dough; rest 10 min.
Divide into 10 balls; pat into 10–12 cm rounds.
Cook on medium-hot griddle 2–3 min per side, brushing with coconut oil, until brown spots appear.
Serve warm.

title: Turmeric Rice (Yellow Rice)
description: Fragrant turmeric rice cooked with ghee, pandan, and spices; a festive centerpiece.

steps: Rinse rice until clear; drain.
Melt ghee in a pot; fry cinnamon stick, cardamom pod, clove, and pandan leaf 1 min.
Add rice; stir 1–2 min; add water, turmeric powder, and salt.
Bring to boil; cover and cook on low 15 min; rest 10 min; fluff and serve.

title: Sri Lankan Chicken Biryani
description: Layered spiced rice and chicken baked with ghee-fried onions and raisins; served with raita.

instructionSections.title: Method
steps: Parboil basmati rice with cinnamon stick, cardamom pod, salt, and ghee until 70% done; drain.
Marinate chicken with yogurt, biryani masala, and salt 30 min.
Fry onion in ghee until golden; remove half for garnish.
Add marinated chicken; cook 10–12 min until partially done.
Layer rice over chicken with raisins, cashew, and pandan leaf; dot with ghee.
Cover and steam on low 20–25 min; rest 10 min; fluff and serve.

title: Lamprais (Dutch-Burgher Lump Rice)
description: Banana leaf–wrapped rice with mixed meat curry, frikkadels, seeni sambol, and ash plantain; baked for aroma.

instructionSections.title: Assembly
steps: Cook rice with ghee and salt until just done; cool slightly.
Prepare a thick mixed meat curry; pan-fry meatball until browned.
Fry ash plantain with mild spice until tender.
Lightly warm banana leaf over flame to soften.
Place rice on leaf; top with curry, meatball, seeni sambol, and ash plantain.
Wrap tightly; bake at 180 °C for 15–20 min to infuse aroma.
Serve hot in the leaf.

title: Creamy Cashew Curry (Kaju Curry)
description: Luxurious cashew curry simmered with coconut milk, cardamom, and aromatics.

steps: Soak cashew in warm water 30 min; drain.
Heat coconut oil; sauté onion, garlic, and cardamom pod 3–4 min.
Add cashew and 250 ml water; simmer 10–12 min until tender.
Stir in coconut milk; simmer 5–6 min; season with salt and serve.

title: Mango Curry
description: Traditional Sri Lankan sour mango curry with aromatic spices, perfect with rice and curry.

steps: Cut green mango into 2 cm cubes; set aside.
Heat coconut oil in heavy-bottomed pan over medium heat.
Add curry leaves; let them splutter for 30 seconds.
Sauté onion until translucent, about 5 min.
Add garlic and ginger; cook until fragrant, 2 min.
Stir in curry powder, turmeric, and chili powder; cook 1 min.
Add mango cubes; gently mix with spices, cook 3–4 min.
Pour in coconut milk and tamarind juice; bring to gentle boil.
Reduce heat to low; simmer uncovered 15–20 min until mango is tender.
Season with salt and jaggery; adjust sourness with more tamarind if needed.
Simmer 2–3 min more; remove from heat when curry thickens slightly.

title: Mango Achcharu
description: Refreshing Sri Lankan street food salad with green mango, chili, and lime - perfect appetizer or snack.

steps: Wash and peel green mango; cut into thin julienne strips, 5 cm long.
Place mango strips in large bowl; sprinkle with salt and mix well.
Let stand 10 min to draw out excess moisture; drain and rinse briefly.
Add sliced red onion and green chili to drained mango.
In small bowl, whisk together lime juice, sugar, and chili powder until sugar dissolves.
Pour dressing over mango mixture; toss thoroughly to coat.
Add chopped curry leaves, grated coconut, and fresh coriander.
Mix gently but thoroughly; taste and adjust salt, lime, or chili as desired.
Let salad rest 5 min for flavors to meld before serving.
Serve immediately as appetizer or side dish with rice and curry.

title: Mango Dessert
description: Creamy Sri Lankan mango pudding with coconut milk and jaggery - a heavenly tropical dessert.

steps: Peel ripe mango and cut into small cubes; reserve 100g for garnish.
Blend remaining mango with 100ml water until smooth puree; strain if desired.
Mix rice flour with 150ml water to form smooth slurry; set aside.
Heat ghee in heavy-bottomed pan; lightly fry cashew nuts until golden, 2 min; remove and set aside.
In same pan, add grated jaggery with 50ml water; cook on medium heat until melted and syrupy, 5 min.
Add mango puree to jaggery syrup; cook on medium heat, stirring frequently, 8–10 min.
Slowly add rice flour slurry while stirring continuously to prevent lumps.
Cook mixture on low heat, stirring constantly, until it thickens like custard, 10–12 min.
Add coconut milk and cardamom powder; simmer gently 5 min, stirring frequently.
Add pinch of salt; taste and adjust sweetness with more jaggery if needed.
Remove from heat; fold in reserved mango cubes and half the fried cashews.
Pour into serving bowls; garnish with remaining cashews.
Chill in refrigerator 2–3 hours before serving; serve cold.
